folder: Richmond Road & Otis Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text: (1) Richmond Road, east side, between Otis and Bryant Avenues, showing the old Lockman-Taylor-Cortelyou House. For additional information see other views. By Mulford Simonson About 1910 From P.L. Sperr Collection  (2) The rear of the Lockman House, before it was rebuilt. From P. L. Sperr Collection February, 1922  (3) The rear of the Lockman House, after rebuilding. Note the dormer windows which were added on the second floor. From P.L. Sperr Collection August, 1923

folder: Richmond Road & Otis Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1) Richmond Road, east side, between Otis and Bryant Avenues, showing the Lookman-Taylor-Cortelyou House, a colonial home. Because of a burglary in this house, a negro suffered the first legal execution in the county. In James Butler's 1853 map it appears as the E. Taylor house; in Beers's 1874 map as Mrs. S. Barton's house. Succeeding maps from 1887 to 1907 show it to be on property belonging to O.J. Tysen. See "History-Story-Legend of the Old King's Highway" by Staten Island Antiquarian society, p. 14.

About 1900

By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Collection through P. L. Sperr

(2) Another view of the Lookman-Taylor-Cortelyou House, at a later date, showing structural changes.

1924

P. L. Sperr

(3) An additional view of the house at a still later date, showing further changes.

May 26, 1937
